Sentencas: MnCo2O4, MnCo1.7Cu0.3O4 and MnCo1.7Fe0.3O4 are investigated as coatings for corrosion protection of metallic interconnects in solid oxide fuel cell stacks.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Electrophoretic deposition is used to deposit the coatings on Crofer 22 APU alloy.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: All three coating materials reduce the parabolic oxidation rate in air at 900 degrees C and 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: At 700 degrees C there is no significant difference in oxidation rate between coated samples and uncoated pre-oxidized Crofer 22 APU.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The cross-scale area specific resistance (ASR) is measured in air at 800 degrees C using La0.85Sr0.1Mn1.1O3 (LSM) contact plates to simulate the interaction with the cathode in a SOFC stack.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: All coated samples have three times lower ASR than uncoated Crofer 22 APU after 4370 h aging.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: The ASR increase with time is lowest with the MnCo2O4 coating, followed by the MnCo1.7Fe0.3O4 and MnCo1.7Cu0.3O4 coatings.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: LSM plates contacted to uncoated Crofer 22 APU contain significant amounts of Cr after aging, while all three coatings effectively prevent Cr diffusion into the LSM.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: A complex Cr-rich reaction layer develops at the coating alloy interface during oxidation.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Cu and Fe doping reduce the extent of this reaction layer at 900 degrees C, while at 800 degrees C the effect of doping is insignificant.
Titulo: Comparison of iron and copper doped manganese cobalt spinel oxides as protective coatings for solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
